verses.verse: You are the sons <WH1121> of the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>: you shall not cut <WH1413> yourselves <WH7760>, nor make any baldness <WH7144> between your eyes <WH5869> for the dead <WH4191>.

For you are a holy <WH6918> people <WH5971> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>, and the Lord <WH3068> has chosen <WH977> you to be a peculiar <WH5459> people <WH5971> unto himself <WH5971>, above all the nations that are upon <WH6440> the earth <WH127>.
You shall not eat <WH398> any abominable thing <WH8441>.
These are the animals <WH929> which you shall eat <WH398>: the ox <WH7794>, the sheep <WH7716>, and the goat <WH5795>,
The hart <WH354>, and the roebuck <WH6643>, and the red deer <WH3180>, and the wild goat <WH689>, and the pygarg <WH1788>, and the wild ox <WH8377>, and the chamois <WH2169>.

And every animal <WH929> that parts <WH6536> the hoof <WH6541>, and cleaves <WH8157> the hoof <WH8156> into two <WH8147> claws <WH6541>, and chews <WH5927> the cud <WH1625> among the animals <WH929>, that you shall eat <WH398>.

Nevertheless these you shall not eat <WH398> of them that chew <WH5927> the cud <WH1625>, or of them that divide <WH6536> the cloven <WH8156> hoof <WH6541>; as the camel <WH1581>, and the hare <WH768>, and the coney <WH8227>: for they chew <WH5927> the cud <WH1625>, but divide <WH6536> not the hoof <WH6541>; therefore they are unclean unto you <WH2931>.

And the pigs <WH2386>, because it divides <WH6536> the hoof <WH6541>, yet chews not the cud <WH1625>, it is unclean <WH2931> unto you <WH398>: you shall not eat of their flesh <WH1320>, nor touch <WH5060> their dead carcass <WH5038>.
These you shall eat <WH398> of all that are in the waters <WH4325>: all that have fins <WH5579> and scales <WH7193> shall you eat <WH398>:
And whatever has not fins <WH5579> and scales <WH7193> you may not eat <WH398>; it is unclean unto you <WH2931>.
Of all clean <WH2889> birds <WH6833> you shall eat <WH398>.
But these are they of which you shall not eat <WH398>: the eagle <WH5404>, and the ossifrage <WH6538>, and the ospray <WH5822>,
And the glede <WH7201>, and the kite <WH344>, and the vulture <WH1772> after his kind <WH4327>,
And every raven <WH6158> after his kind <WH4327>,
And the owl <WH1323>, and the night hawk <WH8464>, and the cuckow <WH7828>, and the hawk <WH5322> after his kind <WH4327>,
The little owl <WH3563>, and the great owl <WH3244>, and the swan <WH8580>,
And the pelican <WH6893>, and the gier eagle <WH7360>, and the cormorant <WH7994>,
And the stork <WH2624>, and the heron <WH601> after her kind <WH4327>, and the lapwing <WH1744>, and the bat <WH5847>.
And every creeping thing <WH8318> that flies <WH5775> is unclean <WH2931> unto you <WH398>: they shall not be eaten.
But of all clean <WH2889> birds <WH5775> you may eat <WH398>.

You shall not eat <WH398> of any thing that dies of itself <WH5038>: you shall give <WH5414> it unto the stranger <WH1616> that is in your gates <WH8179>, that he may eat <WH398> it <WH4376>; or you may sell it unto an alien <WH5237>: for you are an holy <WH6918> people <WH5971> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>. You shall not boil <WH1310> a kid <WH1423> in his mother <WH517>'s milk <WH2461>.
You shall truly <WH6237> tithe <WH6237> all the increase <WH8393> of your seed <WH2233>, that the field <WH7704> brings forth <WH3318> year <WH8141> by year <WH8141>.

And you shall eat <WH398> before <WH6440> the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>, in the place <WH4725> which he shall choose <WH977> to place <WH7931> his name <WH8034> there <WH4643>, the tithe of your corn <WH1715>, of your wine <WH8492>, and of your oil <WH3323>, and the firstborn <WH1062> of your herds <WH1241> and of your flocks <WH6629>; that you may learn <WH3925> to fear <WH3372> the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> always <WH3117>.

And if the way <WH1870> be too long <WH7235> for you <WH3588>, so that you are not able <WH3201> to carry <WH5375> it <WH4725>; or if the place be too far <WH7368> from you <WH3068>, which the Lord your God <WH430> shall choose <WH977> to set <WH7760> his name <WH8034> there <WH3068>, when the Lord your God <WH430> has blessed you <WH1288>:

Then shall you turn <WH5414> it into money <WH3701>, and bind up <WH6696> the money <WH3701> in your hand <WH3027>, and shall go <WH1980> unto the place <WH4725> which the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> shall choose <WH977>:

And you shall bestow <WH5414> that money <WH3701> for whatever your soul <WH5315> lusts after <WH183>, for oxen <WH1241>, or for sheep <WH6629>, or for wine <WH3196>, or for strong drink <WH7941>, or for whatever your soul <WH5315> desires <WH7592>: and you shall eat <WH398> there before <WH6440> the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>, and you shall rejoice <WH8055>, you <WH1004>, and your household,
And the Levite <WH3881> that is inside your gates <WH8179>; you shall not forsake <WH5800> him <WH2506>; for he has no part nor inheritance with you <WH5159>.

At the end <WH7097> of three <WH7969> years <WH8141> you shall bring forth <WH3318> all the tithe <WH4643> of your increase <WH8393> the same year <WH8141>, and shall lay it up <WH3240> inside your gates <WH8179>:

And the Levite <WH3881>, (because he has no part <WH2506> nor inheritance <WH5159> with you <WH1616>,) and the stranger, and the fatherless <WH3490>, and the widow <WH490>, which are inside your gates <WH8179>, shall come <WH935>, and shall eat <WH398> and be satisfied <WH7646>; that the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> may bless <WH1288> you in all the work <WH4639> of your hand <WH3027> which you do <WH6213>.
